ovdesc.p: This table is used for capturing results of extracts reconciliation

desc.p: Capture result ID for files will be combination of,
a. FILE.NAME of DW.EXPORT record[[-LOCAL] where LOCAL means any local name suffixed for customer specific extract / product specific extract.
b. DW.EXPORT.PARAM.ID – The above particular file is extracted through which PARAM ID.
c. MIS.DATE – The Business date, on which the extract is done
CONTROL.LIST - This defines the sub-selection process for this particular file extract.
For example, CATEG.ENTRY - there are three sub-select process before extracting the data - BUILD.WORK.FILE, PROCESS.NETTED, PROCESS.NON.NETTED.
And also this control list aids for better performance.
select statement returned as part of select api for particular file
select statement will return number of records selected as part of select api for particular file
count of records selected
Number of records processed from the above selected records
Number of records filtered without processing further
Example: Expired contracts filter, contracts related to last working day alone etc., done at the PROCESS/FILTER API level
Number of records extended while processing the selected records
Exmaple: STMT.ENTRIES which have netted and non-netted entries, the netted entries have one or more non-netted entries
The extracts will populate extended entries for each netted entries
Hash total field name defined for a particular DW.EXPORT file
The running total of all records extracted for a particular DW.EXPORT file.
The total number of records that are being extracted as per in HASH.TOTAL.csv for a particular DW.EXPORT file
The difference between the number of records selected and (processed + filtered) records
The difference between the number of records extended against the hash total number of records for a particular file as per in HASH.TOTAL.csv
The name of the CSV file for which we are going to capture all the information related to
This field ensure that 1 st character in the particular csv file matches with UTF-16BE BOM CHARACTER
If BOM CHARACTER matches it will results as 'YES' else 'NO'
The number of headings available for particular csv file
Count the number of delimiters in each row and find the minimum of them for this particular csv file
Count the number of delimiter in each row and find the maximum of them for this particular csv file
Count the number of delimiters available in the corresponding txt file for a particular csv file
This field results the difference between MIN.ROW.NOS and MAX.ROW.NOS and it should be zero for proper extract
Both the values should always be equal.
If the value is other than zero, then there is problem in the particular csv file
This fields results in difference between NO.OF.HEADINGS and MAX.ROW.NOS, and this should be zero for proper extract
Both the values from NO.OF.HEADINGS and MAX.ROW.NOS should be equal
If the value is other than zero, then there is problem in the particular csv file
This fields results in difference between NO.OF.HEADINGS and TXT.NO.OF.FLDS, and this should be 3 for proper extract
If NO.OF.HEADINGS is 30, means then TXT.NO.OF.FLDS should be 27 always to have the extract properly (by excluding the LEAD.CO.MNE, BRANCH.CO.MNE, and MIS.DATE)
If the value is other than 3, then there is problem in the corresponding txt file for this particular csv file.
